title: Smiths City and Crusaders make donations to fire heroes
text:
Smiths City and Crusaders make donations to fire heroes CHRIS HUTCHING Last updated 16:21, February 24 2017 JOHN KIRK-ANDERSON/FAIRFAX NZ 
Firefighters' efforts over the past two weeks brought the Port Hills fires under control. 
Canterbury firefighters are receiving thanks and donations from the BNZ Crusaders and retailer Smiths City. 
Smiths City will donate five percent of this weekend's sales, and the BNZ Crusaders and sponsor Infor have given 400 tickets to Civil Defence and fire crews for Saturday night's opening Super Rugby match against the Brumbies. 
Several of the BNZ Crusaders players took the tickets to a morning briefing of the firefighters as they prepared for another hot day on the Port Hills where they have been fighting fires for two weeks. SUPPLIED 
Firefighters' efforts battling the Port Hills blazes will be rewarded with a donation by Smiths City. 
A free drink is being donated by AMI Stadium manager VBase to the blaze battlers to help lubricate their well deserved night out. 
READ MORE: 
The BNZ Crusaders will also sign Sam Whitelock's playing jersey from Saturday's game and give it to the family of helicopter pilot, Steve Askin, who died while helping to fight the Port Hills fires. SUPPLIERS 
A BNZ Crusaders team member talks with firefighters at their morning briefing where they were given free tickets to the weekend match against the Brumbies. 
The Smiths City donation will be made from the company's three stores in Christchurch in Colombo St, Northwood and Riccarton. 
"We wanted to say good on you and thank you. We're a Christchurch-based company and many of our staff and customers were affected in some way," Roy Campbell, chief executive Smiths City said. 
"We all read the stories and saw the pictures and wanted to do something for the firefighters." 
"We hope Christchurch shoppers will really get behind this initiative," Campbell said. 
Smiths City will also offer a discount directly to individual local firefighters who shop at the three Christchurch stores until the end of March. 
To be eligible, fire fighters will need to show official identification and other terms and conditions apply. 
The firefighters were Selwyn and Christchurch rural and urban firefighters. - Stuff
